image.altText: Kangaroo road sign

props.synopsis: Police will allege in court that the man tied the kangaroo to the back of his car and dragged it from a property to the road, approximately 400 metres, while the animal was still alive.

title.children: Man charged with animal cruelty after kangaroo allegedly dragged by car

image.altText: A black gun on a piece of plastic that reads Australian Federal Police

props.synopsis: A teacher is being investigated after police say they brought a 3D-printed gun to a Canberra school, in what they believe may have been a “misguided effort to demonstrate the capabilities of 3D printing”.

title.children: ACT teacher allegedly brings 3D-printed firearm to school

image.altText: A sign on the exterior of an office building that reads "Interchange Health Cooperative".

props.synopsis: In an election promise, federal Labor pledges $3.8 million to ensure a Canberra health co-op, which had nearly 5,000 patients on the books, can reopen.

title.children: Reprieve for Canberra bulk-billing practice as private operator steps in

image.altText: A shrub at Belconnen Oval.

props.synopsis: A new $4 million wetland at Belconnen oval in Canberra opens in a bid to help reduce pollution caused by stormwater runoff into Lake Ginninderra and decrease its likelihood of toxic blue-green algae blooms.

title.children: 'Like a hydroponic garden': Wetland to reduce Belconnen lake pollution

image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: a graphic showing two dollar signs over a house in between two trees

props.synopsis: Young renters are feeling the stress of an unstable rental market and are putting off significant life plans as new data reveals most investment properties are sold within two years of being rented out.

title.children: Most investment properties sold within two years of being rented, study finds

props.synopsis: Exclusive data shows skyrocketing rents have outpaced income growth in every regional area in Australia and all but one capital city.

title.children: Ballooning rents outpace wages in regions and all but one capital city

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese smiling on rainbow background.

props.synopsis: For the first time in generations of elections, the major parties are both promising policies to lift housing supply, and again handing out gifts to first homebuyers. But there's an elephant in the room neither Labor nor the Coalition will discuss.

title.children: Labor and the Coalition are promising to help first-time buyers. This is what's missing

image.altText: A woman and a man standing outside of a home near a fence.

props.synopsis: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

title.children: Australia's growing renter population say homeownership is out of reach

image.altText: Peter Dutton with candidate Matt Moran

props.synopsis: Ute drivers have become a convenient hi-vis political icon for the Coalition but the increase in utes and SUVs in Australia outnumbers tradies as tax policies make buying big cars attractive.

title.children: Ute Man is a more complicated hero than the Coalition makes out

image.altText: A cardboard box with survival products in it. A person's hand is reaching into the box.

props.synopsis: With war on their doorstep, Europeans have been warned to prepare survival kits with enough essentials to last them 72 hours, and Britain's leading disaster expert says the idea has been borrowed from Australia.

title.children: Europeans told to gather supplies for 72 hours amid 'direct' war threat

image.altText: Luke Smith wearing a suit, smiling with his arms crossed while standing in Logan's council chambers.

props.synopsis: "Bitch with the glasses" and "Well f***en get on the team, bitch" were among comments picked up by corruption investigators probing Logan City Council, according to the court documents.

title.children: Crooked mayor's conversations caught on secret phone taps, court documents show

image.altText: A body has been found after a large house fire in Geham.

props.synopsis: Cameron Hunt was charged with murder and arson over a fire which killed his wife near Toowoomba.

title.children: Man accused of wife's murder in Queensland fire appears in court

image.altText: Men in suits stand around looking at their screen devices

props.synopsis: Stock markets and currencies continued to react to Donald Trump's tariff comments. ASX futures are pointing marginally lower, while Star Entertainment shares will return to trade today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street closes in the red after volatile trade

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks down a footpath.

props.synopsis: Protesters have ambushed Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at a hotel he was staying at, the latest incident in a series of disruptions that have plagued both sides of politics during the election campaign.

title.children: Albanese confronted by alt-right protesters at hotel, raising security fears

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking out a window into a garden

props.synopsis: Victorian senate candidate Jordan van den Lamb says he will consider an apology to a Victorian woman whose vacant property was occupied by squatters after he published the address online.

title.children: 'I'm not rich': Break-in victim calls out senate candidate's squatting campaign

image.altText: woman with grey hair wearing large beads and a dark blue dress with black curtain behind her

props.synopsis: The ABC's inaugural Elder-in-residence, Professor Jackie Huggins, has come full circle after beginning at the broadcaster as a teenager and will now help lead responses to the Listen Loudly, Act Strongly report into racism.

title.children: The ABC's first Elder-in-residence wants to see a future without racism

image.altText: David Lee in black glasses and blue shirt on a suburban street with grass and houses

props.synopsis: While cost of living and housing are important issues to those in Greater Western Sydney, a key detail major parties will also need to address are the adverse effects of the region’s rapid population growth.

title.children: Why this Western Sydney commuter's drive to work has nearly tripled in duration

image.altText: A military plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: Moscow's relationship with Jakarta is in the spotlight, after a report claimed the Kremlin had asked to station war planes at an air base 1,200 kilometres from Darwin.

title.children: Russia 'working quietly' on Indonesia military ties before air base storm

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone in their hand, with a sports betting app open on the phone.

props.synopsis: For years, Australia’s de facto online gambling regulator has been based in the Northern Territory. Advocates say that’s a problem and are urging the next federal government to take action.

title.children: Online gambling regulator chair admits accepting gifts from bookmakers

image.altText: Actor Gene Hackman with wife Betsy Arakawa

props.synopsis: A lengthy police investigation has revealed Betsy Arakawa was researching medical conditions relating to COVID-19 in the days leading up to her death.

title.children: Gene Hackman's wife researched her rodent-borne disease days before death

image.altText: Actress Cate Blanchett standing on the red carpet smiling

props.synopsis: The Australian-born Oscar-winning actress says there were many things she wanted to do with her life following the release of her latest major spy film, Black Bag.

title.children: Aussie star Cate Blanchett 'serious' about giving up acting

image.altText: A Bureau of Meteorology cyclone tracking map

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Errol has formed in waters off the northern Kimberley coast and is expected to become a category three system by Thursday morning.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Errol forms, predicted to become category three system

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, standing above Donald Trump, spread his hands.

props.synopsis: The man who was named by Pete Hegseth in the Houthi leaked war group chat as the best staff point of contact for the National Security Council has been placed on administrative leave.

title.children: Top Pete Hegseth adviser put on leave in Pentagon leak probe

image.altText: A man stands in a street full of street art and graffiti holding a large drawn robot face over his own.

props.synopsis: Just like street art or graffiti, sticker art is sometimes maligned or misunderstood. In a bid to change that, Australia's growing number of sticker artists, along with their international peers, are showcasing their work in a Sydney expo.

title.children: When Roni realised she had 5,000 photos of stickers, she had to share them

image.altText: A screen on the dash of an electric vehicle showing how much power the battery has.

props.synopsis: A push to get EV chargers installed on Queensland's Capricorn Coast has been suspended following the broadcast of a report on "dirty nickel".

title.children: EV charger plan suspended after mayor watches commercial media report

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton smiling for a photo before the Sky News election debate

props.synopsis: Today's debate between the prime minister and the opposition leader will be broadcast by the ABC.

title.children: How to watch the second debate between Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton

image.altText: A man in a black blazer sits before a microphone

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's foreign minister says he personally hopes Labor wins the Australian election, stating the incumbent government had done "a tremendous job" of rebuilding relationships in the Pacific.

title.children: 'This is personal': Pacific foreign minister wants Labor election win

image.altText: A man in a dark blue suit stands at the top of stairs leading to an airplane smiling and waiving at the camera

props.synopsis: Chinese President Xi Jinping has landed in Malaysia after visiting Vietnam, as he tries to secure more support from South-East Asian neighbours amid the trade war with Donald Trump.

title.children: China 'tearing down walls' as it looks to boost trade ties in Asia

image.altText: A bird with a bright blue head, black eye banding, white belly and black and teal wing perched on a stick just off the ground.

props.synopsis: The complex songs of the tiny social bird could advertise whether it's a risk-taking explorer or a stay-at-home defender, and influence how it chooses a mate.

title.children: Adventurous or aggressive? Fairy-wren song reveals bird's personality

image.altText: Aston Villa players look disappointed while PSG players celebrate, and fans in the crowd set off flares

props.synopsis: Premier League side Aston Villa comes within a goal of pulling off a remarkable Champions League comeback against Paris Saint Germain in a dramatic quarterfinal second leg.

title.children: Villa fall short of miraculous Champions League comeback as PSG hold on

image.altText: A bald man wearing a white t-shirt speaking to reporters, with an angry expression and one finger raised in the air

props.synopsis: Papers filed last week accuse the online influencer, a self-described misogynist, of rape and sexual assault, and of pointing a gun at a woman's face.

title.children: Andrew Tate to face UK civil trial over rape and coercive control claims

image.altText: Police car lights lit up at night.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with manslaughter almost two months after he allegedly crashed into a car driven by a pregnant teenager whose newborn baby later died in hospital.

title.children: Driver charged with manslaughter after newborn dies in hospital

image.altText: Demonstrators rally holding signs that say hands off Harvard

props.synopsis: The funding freeze comes after the institution said it would reject the Trump administration's demands to change hiring, admissions and other policies.

title.children: Harvard hit with $US2.2 billion funds freeze after defying Trump demands
